Usage: Someone gives something to a person who is not a member of the giver’s in group but whose status is about equal to that of the giver.
Someone gives some action as a favour to a person who is not a member of the giver’s in group but whose status is about equal of the giver.
English: Do something for someone; do someone a favour by doing something

Usage: The space between two temporal or physical points.
The degree of something is not great.
An inanimate thing exists.
Something has been done to something and the resultant state of that action remains.
Some state or action takes place at a time (not always immediately) after another state or action has taken place.
A conjunction which indicates that the preceding clause expresses a conditional.
A particle which indicates that something is the only thing or state which exists, or the action someone will take, takes, is taking or took.
English: Only; just; be ready to do something; have just done something; just did something; be just doing something; about

Usage: A phrase which expresses the speaker’s regret.
A particle which expresses a limit imposed upon something that is growing and expanding.
English: Only; just; alone; merely; that’s all

Usage: Not only X but also Y, where X and Y can be either a noun, a verb, or an adjective.
An auxiliary indicating the speaker’s conjecture which is not based on any particular information or evidence.
Something that has been latent is realised.
A particle which indicates location, except for location of existence.
A particle which indicates the use of something for doing something.
English: By; for; from; in; on; using; with

Usage: A particle (apparently derived from the て form of です) that indicates a weak causal relationship.
English: And; because of; due to; because

Usage: A particle which indicates the time when something terminates or the amount of time a period of activity has taken.
The て form of です plus も ‘even’.
An interrogative adverb which asks about the state of someone/something or the way of doing something.
A particle that indicates the direction toward which some directional movement or action proceeds.
A disjunctive coordinate conjunction that combines two sentences.
An auxiliary verb attached to a psychological/physiological adjective meaning a person other than the speaker shows signs of ~
Approximately (with a specific point of time).
Something takes place regularly in succession after a certain temporal or spatial interval.
Someone/something begins to do something or begins to be in some state.
A dependant noun which expresses the speaker’s expectation that something will take place or took place or that someone/something is or was in some state.
English: I expect that ~; it is expected that ~; ~ is expected to; I am fairly certain that ~; should; ought to; it is natural that ~; no wonder ~

Usage: A particle which indicates an extent or a degree to which someone/something does something or is in some state.
English: To the extent of; to the extent that ~; (not as) ~ as ~; about

Usage: It is strongly suggested that someone do something.
Comparing two entities, one is in some state or does something more than the other.
English: ~ be more (adjective) than ~; ~ do something more (adverb) than ~ do

Usage: Something is desired by the speaker.
Want someone (who is not higher in status than the speaker) to do something.
A superlative marker.
Someone or something moves in a direction away from the speaker or the speaker’s viewpoint.
Some action or state keeps changing from the point in time at which the speaker first describes the action.
An animate thing exists.
Someone or something is doing something he or it started some time ago, or is in a state created by an action he or it took some time ago.
Someone, something needs something
A reflexive pronoun that refers (back) to a human subject with whom the speaker is empathising.
A reflexive pronoun that refers (back) to a human subject, the referent of which is contrasted with someone else.
A particle which marks an alternative.
A sentence final particle which indicates that the preceding sentence is interrogative.
A marker for an embedded yes-no question.
English: Whether or not; if (~ or not)

Usage: Can't tell if ~
A particle which indicates a starting point or a source.
After/since a point in time at which something takes place.
A subordinate conjunction which expresses a reason or a cause.
A sentence final particle which expresses the idea that the female speaker wonders about something.
A noun forming suffix that indicates a way or a manner in which one does something.
English: A way of; a manner of; how to

Usage: Something (including an action) replaces something else.
English: In place of ~; instead of; to make up for ~; although; but

Usage: A disjunctive subordinate conjunction that combines two sentences.
Something is passively and spontaneously audiable.
Something or someone is what someone does not like.
A thing which is intangible.
A nominaliser used to indicate the speaker’s relative lack of empathy with the content of the sentence he is nominalising.
There was a time when ~
English: Someone has done something; someone has had an experience doing something; there was a time when ~

Concept: ことが出来る・できる
Usage: Doing something is possible
An event takes place as if spontaneously, irrespective of the speaker's volition.
English: It will be decided that ~; come about ~; be arranged that ~; turn out that ~

Usage: A volitional decision to do something is made.
Speaking of proposition X, X is certainly true.
English: Indeed one does something alright, (but ~); indeed ~ (but ~); do ~ (but ~)

Usage: An auxiliary verb which indicates a polite request.
Approximate quantity or extent.
Someone whose status is not higher than the speaker’s gives something to the first person or to someone with whom the speaker empathises.
Someone does something as a favour to the first person or to someone with whom the speaker empathises.
English: Do something (for me or someone); do me or someone a favour by doing something

Usage: Someone or something moves in a direction towards the speaker or the speaker’s viewpoint or area of empathy.
An auxiliary verb which indicates the beginning of some process or continuation of some action up to a current point of time.
English: Come about; grow; come to; begin to

Usage: Someone or something is in some state he or it was in some time ago.
A particle to indicate a spatial, temporal or quantitative limit or an unexpected animate/inanimate object.
English: As far as; till; up to; until; through; even

Usage: A particle that indicates a time limit on/for an action.
In front of or before some situation comes about.
A prefix which means ‘every (unit of time)’.
An already given situation or condition remains unaltered.
English: As it is; unchanged; undisturbed; leave as is; remain

Usage: A verb ending which indicates the first person’s volition or invitation in formal speech.
English: I/We will do something; Let’s do something.

Usage: Someone or something is passively/spontaneously visible.
Do something to see what it’s like or what will happen.
English: Do something and see; try to do something

Usage: A particle which indicates that a proposition about the preceeding element X is also true when another similar proposition is true.
A marker which indicates emphasis.
Someone or something is no longer in the same state that he or it was in some time ago.
English: (not) anymore; (not) any longer; already; yet; now

Usage: The repeated use of a particle meaning ‘also’ to list elements belonging to the same part of speech.
The speaker presents some situation as if it were a tangible object.
English: Because; how could ~!; used to; should like to; should

Usage: The first person or someone the speaker empathises with receives something from someone whose status is not as high as the receiver’s.
The first person or someone the speaker empathizes with receives some benefit from an action by someone whose status is not as high as the receiver’s.
English: Receive benefit from an action by someone; have something done by someone; have someone do something.

Usage: A negative imperative marker used by a male speaker in very informal speech
A marker that indicates exemplification.
English: And so on; and the like; for example; things like ~

Usage: A conjunction which indicates that the action expressed by the preceding verb takes place concurrently or simultaneously with the action expressed in the main clause.
A negative て form of a verb.

Usage: It won’t do if someone does not take some action or if someone or something is not in some state.
It has reached the point where some state or action does not take place anymore.
A て form of the negative ない, which indicates a cause/reason for a state or action.
English: Do not do something and ~; is not ~ and ~; because ~ do not do something

Usage: A conjunction which indicates that the preceding sentence is the speaker’s supposition about the truth of a present or past fact or the actualisation of something in the future.
English: If it is true that; if it is the case that; if; would; could

Usage: A polite imperative used by superiors such as parents or teachers to their inferiors (=people of younger age and lower rank)
A sentence final particle that indicates the speaker’s request for confirmation or agreement from the hearer about some shared knowledge.
English: English tag question (such as isn’t it?; is it?; don’t you?; do you?); you know

Usage: A particle that indicates a point of time at which something takes place.
An indirect object marker.
A particle that indicates an agent or a source in passive, causative, もらう/てまらう and other receiving constructions.
A particle that indicates the surface of something upon which some action directly takes place.
A particle which indicates purpose when someone moves from one place to another.
English: To do something; in order to do something

Usage: A particle which indicates the location where someone or something exists.
A particle which indicates a place toward which someone or something moves.

Concept: に違いない・にちがいない
Usage: The speaker is convinced that there is no mistake on his part in guessing something.

Usage: Something or someone is hard to ~.

Usage: A phrase that indicates a generally agreed upon standard (the entire sentence that includes this phrase expresses some deviation from that standard.)
Someone has decided on something.
A particle which, with a preceding noun phrase, forms a phrase to modify a following noun phrase.
English: ‘s; of; in; at; for; by; from

Usage: A dependent indefinite pronoun.
A nominaliser which is used when the nominalised sentence expresses a directly perceptible event.
English: That ~; to do something; doing something

Usage: A sentence-final particle used by a female or a child to indicate an explanation or emotive emphasis.

A sentence ending which indicates that the speaker is explaining or asking for an explanation about some information shared with the hearer, or is talking about something emotively, as if it were of common interest to the speaker and the hearer.
English: The explanation is that ~; The reason is that ~; The fact is that ~; It is that ~

Usage: A subordinate conjunction which expresses a reason or a cause.
Contrary to everybody’s expectation based on the sentence preceding のに, the proposition in the sentence following のに is the case.
English: Even though; despite the fact that ~; although; but; in spite of the fact that ~

Usage: In the process or for the purpose of doing something expressed in the の nominalised clause.

Usage: A structure that indicates new, important information by placing it between のは and the copula だ (の is an indefinite pronoun (の2) that replaces ‘time’,’person’, ‘thing’, ‘place’ or ‘reason’.)
English: It is ~ that ~; the one who ~ is ~; the place where ~ is ~; the reason why ~ is ~; the time when ~ is ~; what ~ is ~

Usage: A particle which indicates a space in/on/across/through/along which someone or something moves.
English: In; on; across; through; along; over

Usage: (of quantity or number) a lot

Usage: Finish doing ~
A state or an action cannot be controlled by someone or something.
An auxiliary verb which indicates potential.

Usage: An auxiliary adjective which indicates that the preceding sentence is the speaker’s conjecture based on what he has heard, read or seen.

Usage: A suffix that makes a noun out of an adjective by attaching it to the stem of an Adj (い) or much less frequently to the stem of an Adj (な)
A suffix (originally meaning 'appearance') that indicates the speaker's/writer's politeness towards someone.
Cause someone/something to do something or cause something to change its state.
English: Make someone/something do something; cause someone/something to do something; let someone/something do something; allow someone/something to do something; have someone/something do something; get someone/something to do something.

Usage: A conjunction to indicate ‘and’ in an emphatic way.

Usage: Someone gets information from some outside source.
An auxiliary which indicates that the information expressed by the preceding sentence is what the speaker heard.

Usage: An auxiliary adjective which indicates that what is expressed by the preceding sentence is the speaker’s conjecture concerning an event in the future or the present state of someone or something, based on what the speaker sees or feels.

Usage: A conjunction to indicate that what is stated in the preceding sentence is the reason or cause for what is stated in the following sentence.

A conjunction that indicates (1) temporally contiguous actions or states, or (2) a cumulative listing of objects, actions or states.

Usage: If that is the case,
A coordinate conjunction which connects two alternatives expressed by sentences.
A coordinate conjunction that connects two sentences.

Small in number of quantity.

Usage: Someone or something has some (semi)permanent attribute.
Something is perceived by someone’s non-visual senses.
A verb that indicates how much something costs or a duration of time.

A coordinate conjunction which connects two sentences (the second sentence either describes an event which takes place right after the event described in the first sentence or it expresses a logical guess related to the event in the first sentence.)
An auxiliary adjective which expresses a desire to do something.

Concept: 堪らない・たまらない
Usage: The speaker or whomever he empathises with cannot cope with a situation expressed by the て phrase.

Usage: A noun that indicates a benefit, a purpose, a reason or a cause.

Usage: A subordinate conjunction which indicates that the action/state expressed by the main clause in a sentence takes place after the action/state expressed by the subordinate clause.
A phrase which expresses a suggestion (literally: How would you feel if you do something?)

Usage: A phrase which expresses an inexhaustive listing of action or states.

Usage: Even if someone did something or something were in some state (the desired result would not come about) or even if someone or something is in some state.
The て form ending of verbs and い-type adjectives (The て form ending of な-type adjectives and the て form of the copula is で.)
ても is used when that which is expressed in the main clause is not what is expected from the content of the dependent (ても) clause.
A phrase which expresses persmission or concession.

Usage: A particle which lists things exhaustively.
A particle marking the noun phrase which maintains a reciprocal relationship with the subject of a clause.

Usage: A subordinate conjunction which marks a condition that brings about an uncontrollable event or state.
An expression which presents as the topic of a following discourse a phrase which has just been uttered.
A phrase marking information which identifies or explains the noun following the phrase.

A place is in a location which takes a certain amount of time to get to.

Usage: A compound particle which indicates the capacity, role or function of someone or something.
A compound particle which indicates a standard for comparisons.
An intention or conviction of a speaker (or a person with whom the speaker can empathise) about his future or past actions or current state.

Usage: A colloquial topic-introducer.
A colloquial quotation marker.
During a period when a certain situation remains in effect.
A particle which marks a topic or a contrastive element.

A coordinate conjunction that is used to list two or more items (nouns or noun phrases) in an inexhaustive fashion.
An adverb indicating that the actual situation expectedly/anticipatively conforms to a standard based on past experience, comparison with other people, or common sense.

Usage: An auxiliary な type adjective which expresses the likelihood of something/someone or the likeness of something/someone to something/someone.

Usage: Some change takes place gradually.
